questions.a: LUMA (Layout & UX Mockup Analyzer) is a CLI tool that validates UI scaffolds against design system patterns, layout rules, and accessibility best practices.

questions.q: What file format does LUMA accept?
questions.a: LUMA accepts JSON files with schemaVersion '1.0.0' containing a screen hierarchy with nodes (Stack, Grid, Box, Text, Button, Field, Form, Table).

questions.q: How do I run a full analysis?
questions.a: Run these commands in sequence: 1) luma ingest <file>, 2) luma layout <file> --viewports 375x667,1024x768, 3) luma keyboard <file>, 4) luma flow <file> --patterns form,table, 5) luma score <run-dir>

questions.q: What are MUST vs SHOULD pattern rules?
questions.a: MUST rules are blocking - failing them results in exit code 3 and failed score. SHOULD rules are recommendations that reduce score by 10 points each but don't block.

questions.q: How is the overall score calculated?
questions.a: Overall = round(0.45×PatternFidelity + 0.25×FlowReachability + 0.20×HierarchyGrouping + 0.10×ResponsiveBehavior). Passing requires overall ≥ 85, no MUST failures, and no unreachable nodes.
LUMA v1.0 includes Form.Basic (GOV.UK) and Table.Simple (IBM Carbon). Run 'luma patterns --list' to see all patterns.
Add 'overrides' array to nodes with { minWidth: <pixels>, <properties> }. Overrides apply when viewport width ≥ minWidth. Last matching override wins.
All outputs go to .ui/runs/<timestamp>/ containing ingest.json, layout_*.json, keyboard.json, flow.json, and score.json.
Yes! Use 'luma score <run-dir> --weights <json>' with custom weights. Weights must sum to 1.0.

questions.q: What exit codes does LUMA use?
questions.a: 0=success, 2=invalid input, 3=blocking issues (MUST failures/unreachable nodes/score<85), 4=internal error, 5=unsupported schemaVersion
Yes. Same input always produces same output. No network calls. No randomness. Fixed heuristics.

questions.q: How do I see all available commands?
questions.a: Run 'luma capabilities --json' to see all commands, exit codes, and defaults.
